runs.comm: well, well...interesting start. Down the leg side and there's a big appeal from McCullum for a catch. There was a noise, but it was the pad
leg stump again and this time he connects well, dispatched backward of square with a strong bottom-handed flick
nice-looking punchy drive from Lumb, Boult adjusted to the off side and it was met with a solid thunk off Lumb's bat but mid-on was able to get across
latches on to a hint of width, goes up and over backward point - not miles from the fielder - and there's a fumble at third man by Butler which allows a second
aggressive start from England, more width from Boult and Hales throws the bat to get a thick top edge that flies over Taylor at slip down to third man
full at off stump, aims to drive through the covers but loses shape on the shot a little
starts full at off stump, sweetly driven just to the right of mid-off and they decline the chance of a single. Misjudgement from the batsmen
big shot for lbw but the umpire was walking away pretty quickly, full at the stumps and Lumb aims through the leg side but height was perhaps the issue
ooh, well bowled. That's a cracker. Jags back from a good length and goes past Hales' inside edge then over middle and off stump
nicely bowled again, full length and finds an inside edge as Hales shapes to play to the off side...standing leg-side of the ball
swing and a miss outside off stump as Hales tries for a booming cover drive
close! Falls short of cover. On off stump and Hales spoons his drive just in front of Nathan McCullum. Top class maiden to start with.
drags a length ball from off stump to the left of mid-on who dives to make the save
nearly! Has to go down as a drop by Taylor at slip. Hales got a top edge on his pull, it went high towards Taylor who thrust up his right hand and couldn't quite time his leap properly
flicked off middle stump out to deep square
driven off the back foot to cover
another attempt at a big shot, tries to pull a ball that wasn't short enough and smashes it into his pads...Hales looks out of touch
that's better, comes down the pitch an drives this in the air straight of mid-off...kept his shape this time
cracking shot from Lumb, takes a full ball on off stump and drives it cleanly straight down the ground
and another! McClenaghan responded by pulling his length and Lumb picked him up from outside off over deep midwicket with a short-armed pull
goes fuller again, finds the inside edge into the pads as Lumb tries another powerful off-side blow

dropped, confusion in the field! It was a massive top edge from Hales as he aimed to flick this over the leg side. Ross Taylor, who seemed closest, didn't seem to move much but Brendon McCullum called for it with the gloves and nearly got there as he sprinted towards square leg. Grant Elliott was also running in. Almost a collision
squeezed into the off side
down the pitch outside leg stump and drilled to cover who makes a good stop
back of a length outside off and pulled through midwicket
poor line on leg stump, Hales doesn't make contact swing to leg but it runs off the pad and beats the keeper then goes to fine leg
that's elegant and a touch of Hales when he's at his best. Full on middle and leg, whipped away through deep square-leg with excellent timing and placement
home side losing the plot a little at the moment, on leg stump again and Hales glances it past short fine-leg
oh dear, that's not going to help New Zealand. Butler sends down a wild bouncer which goes down the leg side and McCullum can't gather it, instead palming it past short fine-leg
England racing away in this chase as Hales latches into another short ball and hooks it past short fine-leg...painful over for Butler, what a contrast to the other day
comes down the pitch and crunches this out to deep midwicket
worked down to long-on
round the wicket, Lumb flicks along the ground to midwicket
dragged down a little short outside off but it's cut straight to cover
can't beat the infield again as he cuts just wide of backward point
worked from outside off down the ground
nicely bowled, full on off stump, pushed back to the bowler. McCullum just calms things down a little
that...is...massive. Short of a length and Hales picked it up very early, stays back in the crease and pulls it in front of square way back into the stand
down the pitch, makes it into a full toss outside leg stump which is driven down to long-on
pushed slightly awkwardly down to long-on
full on leg stump and he rolls his wrists as he flicks to deep square
outside off, played into the pitch and then it bounces towards the covers
well bowled, bit more effort as he bangs this in back of a length and it beats Lumb as he advances down the pitch
gets an inside into his boot as he tries to flick away a full delivery
on the back foot, waits for this to turn a fraction and plays with the hint of spin to short fine-leg
big turn this time, it loops off the surface and beats Lumb's cut
handsome drive as he comes down the pitch, makes it into a half volley and drives to the cover sweeper. Confidence from the batsman after the previous one turned so much
full outside off, driven down the ground
more power and placement from Lumb as he picks this up from outside off, sending it skimming over deep square-leg
starts round the wicket and gets flicked in the air through midwicket from middle and off
that was good cricket from bowler and batsman...Lumb was beaten by Franklin's slower ball, but managed to chip his drive short of long-off
full and wide outside off, another one held back at 98kph, Hales waited for it then drove wide of the cover sweeper
big full toss, Hales gets an inside edge into his pads that runs behind square
another slower ball, I think, which Lumb punches down the ground. It hits the non-striker's leg stump pretty hard but the bails don't come off as it runs to long-on
bottom hand comes into play again as he finds long-on
full on the stumps and worked to deep square
dropped, technically, as he goes back to cut and gets to short third man with a rebound off McCullum's gloves
into the leg side
cracking shot down the ground, Hales flowing down as he drives straight of long-off after using swift footwork
rotates the strike now with a dab square of the wicket
swept from outside off to deep square
back of a length outside off, bottom edged into the ground to point
picked up over the leg side, was full on off stump and Lumb placed it wide of midwicket
another one into the stands, great way to bring up a half century, he was shuffling towards the bowler then pulled a short ball well over deep square
powerful stuff, convincing stuff, one-way traffic...down the pitch and drive straight of mid-off
and again! This isn't a contest at the moment as Hales pulls another attempted bouncer into the stands at deep square
round the wicket, but it doesn't make any difference as Hales makes it three sixes in the over with a straight drive...and it didn't even come quite out of the middle
bunted back to the bowler
starts to advance towards the bowler, then holds his position so he can slog sweep this out to deep square who can't stop it cleanly
cries of 'catch' as Lumb scoops this in the air over the off side but falls comfortably between all the off-side fielders...was nicely flighted by McCullum
this one into the crowd again, a classy, lofted off-side drive as Lumb holds his position and shape as he strikes cleanly through the line

have they missed a run out now? Yes, they have, and in some style. Lumb drove towards cover, brilliant work from Guptill at cover who flicked it back to McCullum who then missed the stumps at his first attempt! It won't matter, but that's not good from New Zealand
worked down the ground
dropped in short, familiar pattern, and it's pulled powerfully to deep square
this will be a quick finish, full on middle and leg which gets flicked easily to fine leg
worked off leg stump to midwicket

what a way to finish! Lumb launches one over the stands at deep square-leg to give him a half-century and, more importantly, England the series. That was his fifth six of the innings, alongside a single four.
